poem.author: Peter McCarey
poem.text: As sparks run through the stubble And a burning cordon inches up the hill this summer night He's drunk on dead wine The bad guy with his rented dinner. Live music at the bar-B-Q Live bait at the bar Live ammo, one presumes, in the piece The grinning barman's groping for. In walks Simone Weil and orders a shandy.
